intro: Lotononis harveyi, commonly known as the Harvey's lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
